content: hey crafters nice to have you with me as you notice this isn't a 2.5 d next video
I'm going to continue to do videos that can apply to both systems so a lot of
things that I make can actually be used in both systems but I'll kind of
differentiate the videos between the two types but today I have a really cool fun
project for you it is a mimic so you can really for your characters with a really
nasty looking mimic so let's go to the table and I'll show you how to graph
that eight crafters this video builds on
techniques I showed in the how to make a mini treasure chest dams craft number
111 so you'll want to make sure to watch that first if you haven't seen that yet
and this will be the body of the creature so make sure you check that out
first if you don't if you're not familiar with a technique alright now I
want to make some teeth for the mimic and I'm going to use toothpicks and I'm
just going to take the ends off the toothpicks you can see the pile I have
there and I put another thing 'post it notes and what I'm going to do is I'm
going to make the gums of the mimic by using the edge of the post-it note so
I'll just start gluing the toothpick ends to the post-it note and I'm going
to do eight in all so I'll just keep applying those until they're nice and
attached to the edge there and there we go let that harden up for a sec now I
need to do some extra gum detail on the edge so I'm just going to add some more
hot glue and that will adhere it better to the to the post-it note as well as
give some detail to the gum so I kind of pull the hot glue out away from the
teeth and that kind of thing now I need to do the reverse and I'm going to make
sure that that's glued down also I want to make sure you get a little bit of
glue between between the teeth itself so that'll give the detail as well as hold
that down securely to that post-it note okay now one last application of the hot
glue and that will build up the gum just a little bit so I'll put a little other
strip of hot glue on there and just kind of pull out between the teeth and
that'll really give a nice definition to those gums okay a little hard to see
with the hot glue alright now I'm going to cut it out and cut out to the edge of
the hot glue there and so I'll have a nice strip of teeth and it's flexible as
you can see which is perfect for our purposes and that now I need to make a
tongue so I'm going to use the post-it note again
and I'm going to kind of pull a tongue shape out in the hot glue it's kind of
hard to see since it's clear but you'll see it here in the light in a second I'm
going to pull through the center that will make the tongue there okay so there
I've cut my tongue out and I'm going to do the reverse side and when you put
some blue on the other side it'll kind of curl the tongue which is what we want
for this project so just add some on the end and I want to make sure to accent
the center of the tongue by dragging the hot glue tip through it and that will
give the center of the tongue okay now I've got my teeth and my top lid which
you know from the treasure chest video you want to make sure you watch that
first okay so I'm going to apply the teeth to the lid put some hot glue on
there just pop it in there and so we'll have some nice teeth nasty nasty teeth
ready to a chompin adventure then I'll fill that kind of in with some hot glue
give a little bit of a texture to the palate okay so now I've got the bottom
and I've got my second pair of teeth so I made two pairs of teeth and I'm going
to glue that into the bottom of the chest and just bend it and pop it in
there with some hot glue and put a little pallet in the bottom there too
and now I've got my tongue so I want to add that so I'm going to put some hot
glue on that put at the back of the chest make sure it's nice and attached
and kind of bend it over while it dries or it hardens that'll make it so it has
like that curl to it which I really like okay so there we go I'll let that harden
up for a few seconds and we're ready to go okay now I've got my two halves at
the top and the bottom and I'm going to glue the two together so I'll just glue
along that connection with it with the lid and the base the bottom and I'll get
it to the angle I want which I want a fairly high angle because I'm going to
add some eyes to this you'll see it'll later okay so
exactly how I want it and let it harden up now I'm going to add the eyes so I'm
going to use beads small beads and I'm going to put some
glue in the corner there and just pop the eye in so it's just kind of a little
acai I really like that effect for the epidemic this is kind of just growing
out of this chest and it'll pop the other eye in make sure there look the
the holes and the beads are looking at the same point so they don't look weird
and there we go so I'm going to use a washer for the base this would be nice
because give a little bit of weight and I'll just I just I'm just going to glue
it down to my workspace here because it'll just pop right off and then I'm
going to do some texture on the washer so I won't just make it look like a flat
base it'll give a little bit of texture and that hardens up pretty quick so now
I'm going to do a little bit on the end so it doesn't just look like a totally
round base and that'll kind of blend into the other texture be careful you
don't burn yourself and get hot and just let that sit for a second and harden
alright it's all hardened and ready for my mimic to attach to it so now I just
want to get the angle right because I want to kind of look like it's jumping
up so it's not going to be flat on the base right so I'm going to add to the
edge I'll go into the edge and then I'll do it so it looks like it's jumping up
so it's at an angle from the base and just hold that until it hot glue sets
and looking good looking good so now I want to do something a little
different I want to do some arms that have kind of popped out of the side of
the chest I thought it'd be kind of fun so I'm just using a toothpick cut it in
half and I'm going to bend it but and break it but not break it off I'm just
bending I'm leaving the break okay so these will
be nasty little spikes that come out of the chest and I'm going to glue that
corner there where I broke it and that will reinforce that and I'll just let
that sit for a little bit until it Rhys I'll make sure to do both of them
that way they'll be all good to go okay now I got a punch and I'm just going to
punch through the cardboard and you see there made a nice hole where the
toothpick will fit and I'll just do the other side and yep
let me ready you notice I haven't done some other details on the chest like the
banding because I figured the mimic is changing so I didn't bother with that
okay so now I'm going to attach the arm so I'm just going to kind of pull out to
make it look like the chest is transforming and I'll do the other side
